intro: Melanorrhoea torquata, commonly known as the black-tongue tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark, almost black, bark and striking yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure containing seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
